events.headline: {ticker} Reports Amazing Earnings!
events.explanation: When a company makes more money than people expected, investors get excited and want to buy more shares.

events.headline: {ticker} Disappoints With Low Earnings
events.explanation: When a company makes less money than expected, some investors sell their shares because they're worried.

events.headline: {ticker} Launches Exciting New Product!
events.explanation: When a company releases a cool new product that everyone wants, more people want to own the company's stock.
events.learningLink: How do products affect stock prices?

events.headline: Tech Stocks Are Hot Right Now!
events.explanation: Sometimes investors get really excited about one type of company, like technology, and all those stocks go up together.

events.headline: Investors Worried About Tech Companies
events.explanation: When investors get nervous about a group of companies, they might sell even good companies in that group.

events.headline: Stock Market Having a Great Day!
events.explanation: Sometimes good news makes everyone feel confident and almost all stocks go up together. This is called a rally!

events.headline: Famous Person Loves {ticker}!
events.explanation: When a famous person says they like a company, some people rush to buy the stock. But be careful - this effect often doesn't last!
events.learningLink: Should you buy based on what celebrities say?

events.headline: {ticker} Announces Dividend Payment!
events.explanation: A dividend is when a company shares some of its profits with shareholders. It's like getting a thank-you gift for owning the stock!

events.headline: {ticker} Partners With Major Company!
events.explanation: When two companies work together, both might make more money. Investors like this news!

events.headline: {ticker} Having Trouble Getting Materials
events.explanation: Sometimes companies can't get the parts they need to make their products. This can hurt their business temporarily.
